title: SHOT: Ammo, mags at Industry Day (24 PICS)
text:
By Guns.com
Tuesday, January 23, 2018 5:10
% of readers think this story is Fact. Add your two cents.
Take a quick tour of the ammo and magazines one display and used during the 13th Annual SHOT Show Industry Day at the Range, which kicks off 2018’s Shooting Hunting Outdoor Trade Show in Las Vegas.
During Monday’s event, a host of exhibitors show off their latest and greatest to outdoor and gun media. The event is open to 1,400 invited media members and 800 buyers who gather at the Boulder Rifle and Pistol Club to try out the freshest guns and ammo from across the industry.
“With over 200 manufacturers exhibiting, and over 500,000 rounds of ammunition shot, Industry Day is the premier shooting event in the industry, giving outdoor media and buyers the opportunity to shoot and test new products for the upcoming year,” according to the NSSF.
Here is a taste of what was needed to fuel the fire.
New Battle Arms magazines for .308 Winchester rounds. (Photo: Daniel Terrill/Guns.com)
Winchester’s making .30-06 150-grain M2 ball ammo in WWII-era “throwback” boxes for M1 Garands, among their new offerings. (Photo: Daniel Terrill/Guns.com)
Empty casings from the .30-caliber rounds. (Photo: Daniel Terrill/Guns.com)
Big, fat double-stack magazines for Mossberg’s mag-fed shotguns. (Photo: Daniel Terrill/Guns.com)
A “Magpump” ammo feeder feeding 5.56 rounds into AR mags. (Photo: Daniel Terrill/Guns.com)
A Maglula feeding device cramming 5.56 rounds into an AR magazine. (Photo: Daniel Terrill/Guns.com)
Stacks of full AR magazines ready for emptying during Industry Day. (Photo: Daniel Terrill/Guns.com)
Random, lonely leftover rounds waiting to be loaded up and sent flying down range. (Photo: Daniel Terrill/Guns.com)
Streak “visual ammunition” are a lot like tracer rounds, but they aren’t incendiary. (Photo: Daniel Terrill/Guns.com)
9mm food over at the Springfield Armory booth (Photo: Chris Eger/Guns.com)
And of course Springer’s new 10mm 1911 line was on an all-brass diet. (Photo: Chris Eger/Guns.com)
(Photo: Chris Eger/Guns.com)
(Photo: Chris Eger/Guns.com)
(Photo: Chris Eger/Guns.com)
Need ammo? Grab a box of Dark Horse. (Photo: Daniel Terrill/Guns.com)
Range pack, you say? (Photo: Chris Eger/Guns.com)
IWI brought a wide array of ammo to the party (Photo: Chris Eger/Guns.com)
(Photo: Chris Eger/Guns.com)
Gotta love M193 when it is stacked deep (Photo: Chris Eger/Guns.com)
The new Coyote mags for the Glock 19X were in rapid circulation (Photo: Chris Eger/Guns.com)
As were more traditional models (Photo: Chris Eger/Guns.com)
Kel-Tec’s KSGs on hand required lots of hulls as did IWI’s new Tavor (Photo: Chris Eger/Guns.com)
(Photo: Chris Eger/Guns.com)
